page.title: 04TYPES OF HOMES IN AMPNEY
page.content: In{Ampney Crucis}most people own their own houses. The{Cotswold {District Council}lets 45 houses. 3 houses are let privately to students. There are 3 tied houses. 4 houses continue to be let by Woodminster to old retainers of the Cripps family. 65 houses were built before 1939. 94 houses are post-war. There are 15 conversions of old buildings into homes. The price of houses is high, Â£65,000 being asked for a semi-detached cottage. Houses sell quickly. Almost all the old houses are built of dressed or rubble{Cotswold {stone, a}few have brick additions. The new houses are of reconstituted stone. The few houses around the farms are used by families, tied or let to students.
